title: Racing 92 to fire All Black Williams over cocaine arrest
title_page: Racing 92 to fire All Black Williams over cocaine arrest | Daily Mail Online
text:
Racing 92 president Jacky Lorenzetti says former All Blacks lock Ali Williams will be fired by the Top 14 club following his arrest for buying cocaine.
Lorenzetti told Midi Olympique magazine that 'unfortunately, Ali Williams will soon be dismissed.'
Williams and former Wallabies back James O'Connor were arrested last month outside a Paris nightclub.
Former All Black star Ali Williams will be fired by Racing 92 after 'attempting to buy cocaine'
Racing 92 president Jacky Lorenzetti will dismiss the 2011 World Cup winner over the incident
Paris prosecutors confirmed Williams was arrested near the Champs Elysees last month
O'Connor was fined for cocaine use by the Paris prosecutor's office while Williams will face a hearing with the prosecutor for buying the equivalent of 2.4 grams of the drug.
Racing 92 had already suspended the 2011 World Cup winner as a precautionary measure and apologized to fans for the incident.
Lorenzetti added that Williams, who will appear before a French rugby disciplinary hearing this month, tested negative for cocaine after his arrest.
O'Connor, 26, the former Australia and London Irish star who plays for Toulon, has had a string of disciplinary problems during a chequered career, including once being suspended indefinitely by the Wallabies after being refused permission to board a flight to Bali from Perth.
The arrests came days after Racing's Dan Carter, another former All Black, apologised for 'a massive error of judgment' after allegedly failing a drink-driving test in France.
Williams and former Australia international James O'Connor were detained by Paris police
The pair were arrested outside a nightclub at Place Charles de Gaulle, by the Champs-Elysees
